key_insight: An autoregressive diffusion framework that generates full-body, multi-person interactions step-by-step, preserving realistic hand motions and dynamic coordination between interactants.
problem_solved: Bridges the gap in interaction synthesis by modeling both detailed hand motion and inter-person coordination simultaneously, overcoming data and complexity limitations that caused prior methods to ignore hands or generate entire sequences at once.
method: Autoregressive diffusion: generate motion in temporal chunks (or tokens) sequentially to improve temporal coherence and capture fine-grained dynamics.
Joint multi-agent modeling: represent multiple interactants together so the model learns coordination cues (body pose + hands) rather than independent motions.
Hierarchical/detail-aware decoding: separate or conditioned modules for coarse body motion and fine hand articulation to retain expressivity while controlling complexity.
impact: Enables more realistic, expressive multi-person motion synthesis for animation, VR/AR, robotics and human-centric simulation, giving practitioners a scalable way to model interactions with detailed hands and tighter temporal coordination.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: autoregressive diffusion loop showing input context → iterative denoising steps → joint multi-person output.
Side-by-side animation frames: comparison of prior methods (no hands / global-only) vs Interact2Ar (full-body + hands) across time.
Close-up insets: hand articulation detail showing finger poses and contact consistency between interactants.
Coordination graph or heatmap: visualization of inter-person dependencies over time (who influences whom at each timestep).
paper_title: Interact2Ar: Full-Body Human-Human Interaction Generation via Autoregressive Diffusion Models
paper_authors: Pablo Ruiz-Ponce, Sergio Escalera, José García-Rodríguez, Jiankang Deng, Rolandos Alexandros Potamias
